snippet: The women, whose plight drew international condemnation, were freed on bail, but an investigation was continuing, one of their lawyers said.
abstract: Chinese prosecutors decide not to immediately press charges against five female activists who were detained for weeks for campaigning against sexual harassment on public transportation; women, whose plight prompted condemnation from officials around world, are released on bail.

byline.contributor: Mia Li and Vanessa Piao contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The women, whose plight drew international condemnation, were freed on bail, but an investigation was continuing, one of their lawyers said.

headline.main: China Releases 5 Women’s Rights Activists Detained for Weeks
headline.print_headline: China Frees 5 Women’s Rights Activists on Bail After Holding Them for Weeks
